page.title: 09HISTORY OF BURSCOUGH 3
page.content: The newest school in Burscough is County Primary built in the 1970's. Lordsgate Township was rebuilt after the 2nd World War when the land it was originally built on was needed for an air field. Burscough was quite an important thoroughfare during the War,with the Leeds to Liverpool Canal, the rail- way running from west to east and north to south and the A59 from Liverpool to Preston. The village was thought to be relatively safe,the Germans trying but failing to bomb it only once.So evacuees came to stay with families from the towns, especially Liverpool, and several people slept in the schools. A Memorial was erected on the A59 to commemorate the dead of both World Wars.
